Obesity is defined as having a Body Mass Index (BMI) of over 30. BMI is a simple measure of body fat based on height and weight. It is used to see if you are overweight or obese, but it's not an exact measure of body fat and there are other ways to assess your risk for health problems related to being overweight or obese. BMI can be calculated using our online calculator, which takes into account your height, weight and sex to generate a score that indicates whether you are normal weight; underweight; overweight; or obese . A BMI of over 30 is considered obese, while a BMI of 25 to 29.9 is overweight. A healthy weight range for your height can be calculated using our online calculator. How to Lose Weight Without Exercise (Oprah Winfrey's Diet) To lose weight effectively and safely, follow these tips: - Eat a healthy, well-balanced diet: This includes incorporating a variety of fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and whole grains into your meals and snacks. Avoid processed and high-fat foods, and aim to control portion sizes to help you consume fewer calories. - Incorporate physical activity into your daily routine: Exercise can help boost your metabolism and burn calories, which can help you lose weight. Aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise or 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity exercise each week. - Get enough sleep: Adequate sleep is important for weight loss, as it can help regulate your appetite and metabolism. Aim for 7-9 hours of sleep per night. - Drink plenty of water: Water is essential for weight loss, as it can help flush out toxins and keep you feeling full. Aim to drink at least 8 glasses of water per day. - Consider weight loss supplements: Some people find that taking weight loss supplements can help them achieve their weight loss goals. However, it's important to speak with a healthcare professional before starting any new supplement regimen. By following these tips, you can work towards achieving a healthy weight without relying solely on exercise. It's important to remember that weight loss is a journey and it takes time, so be patient and stay committed to making healthy lifestyle changes.
